name: Ahmed Ibrahim
aboutme: I am a software engineer with a huge interest in Machine Learning and data-driven decision making. My experience ranges from working on Real-Time messaging systems that can handle thousands of messages per day to scale open-source projects to serve more than 1+ million active users.

company.name: EMURGO
company.about: EMURGO is the official commercial arm and a founding entity of the Cardano blockchain.

roles: Develop public API to enable other developers to build their own dApps on top of Cardano and to serve more than 1 million active users.
Tackle performance bottlenecks related to databases and memory size.
Improve the front-end experience by implementing an entirely new revamped theme.
Wrote end-to-end and unit tests to ensure app integrity.
Review PRs and make sure they follow the code standards and best practices.
Onboard new developers and help them fit into the team.

company.name: Connexease
company.about: Connexease is a real-time multichannel messaging system with more than 700 million messages. It connects agencies with their customers.

roles: Created a messaging system on top of ReactJS on the front and Django/PostgreSQL on the backend.
Created data collection pipelines then analyzed and displayed them in an easy-to-read graph.
Integrated 3rd party platforms including Telegram and Instagram into our messaging system.
Maintained existing integrations including WhatsApp, Twitter, and live chat.
Identified and assessed new technologies before implementation.
Technologies: JavaScript/TypeScript, ReactJS, Python, Django and PostgreSQL.

company.name: Spherium
company.about: The Gateway to a cross-chain interoperable ecosystem that lets users bridge tokens on multiple chains.

roles: Founding member of a team to develop a cross-chain bridge platform
Build the required infrastructure for a transaction queue (API, Cron Job, Scheduler).
Integrated new 12 blockchains that allowed users to easily move tokens between them.
Reduced average request time for most important endpoints from 12s to 2s (6x faster).
Onboarding new developers and helping them fit into the team.
Technologies: JavaScript/TypeScript, ReactJS, NodeJS, MongoDB and Cloud (AWS)

projects.name: Yoroi Wallet
description: A simple, secure and fast Cardano ADA wallet.
Yoroi allows users to manage Ada in their browser. It is a lightweight wallet that launches quickly, allowing users to start sending or receiving Ada in minutes.
The Yoroi browser extension allows users to control their funds with ease, without syncing to the blockchain. Users can easily import their Ada from Daedalus into their Yoroi wallet.

projects.name: Wallet Ecommerce
description: E-Commerce Platform that gives the client a good shopping experience with features like shopping cart, Wishlist, search, advanced filters, checkout, payment, REST API, Auth.
Built using React.js + Redux, Tailwindcss, Node.js, Express.js, Mongoose.js.

projects.name: Connexease
description: Connexease is a real-time multichannel messaging system with more than 700 million messages. It connects agencies with their customers.

projects.name: Connect
description: A social chat  app focused on real time messaging. Utilized React + Redux to render modal page forms that provide users an intuitive UI with components easy to maintain. Features: Register an account and login, save data, join an existing group, or create your own group to communicate with everyone, chat privately with anyone and add them as friends, update user info, fully customizable, Easy to use, easy to use
Built using JavaScript, React.js + Redux, socket.io, Express, MongoDB

js.name: JavaScript
js.about: JavaScript (JS) is a lightweight, interpreted, or just-in-time compiled programming language with first-class functions.

ts.name: TypeScript
ts.about: TypeScript is a strongly typed programming language that builds on JavaScript, giving you better tooling at any scale.

rust.name: Rust
rust.about: Rust is blazingly fast and memory-efficient: with no runtime or garbage collector, it can power performance-critical services, run on embedded devices, and easily integrate with other languages.

python.name: Python
python.about: Python is a programming language that lets you work quickly and integrate systems more effectively.

node.name: NodeJS
node.about: Node.js® is a JavaScript runtime built on Chrome's V8 JavaScript engine.

express.name: Express
express.about: Fast, unopinionated, minimalist web framework for Node.js

django.name: Django
django.about: Django is a high-level Python web framework that encourages rapid development and clean, pragmatic design.

flask.name: Flask
flask.about: Flask is a micro web framework written in Python.

actix.name: Actix
actix.about: A powerful, pragmatic, and extremely fast web framework for Rust

react.name: React
react.about: A JavaScript library for building user interfaces

redux.name: Redux
redux.about: A Predictable State Container for JS Apps

tailwind.name: Tailwind
tailwind.about: Rapidly build modern websites without ever leaving your HTML.

mui.name: Material UI
mui.about: MUI provides a simple, customizable, and accessible library of React components.

sass.name: SASS
sass.about: Sass is the most mature, stable, and powerful professional grade CSS extension language in the world.

html.name: HTML
html.about: HTML5 is a markup language used for structuring and presenting content on the World Wide Web.

css.name: CSS
css.about: Cascading Style Sheets is a style sheet language used for describing the presentation of a document written in a markup language such as HTML

graphql.name: GraphQL
graphql.about: GraphQL is a query language for APIs and a runtime for fulfilling those queries with your existing data

mysql.name: MySQL
mysql.about: MySQL is an open-source relational database management system.

postgres.name: PostgreSQL
postgres.about: The World's Most Advanced Open Source Relational Database

mongodb.name: MongoDB
mongodb.about: MongoDB is a document-oriented NoSQL database used for high volume data storage.

redis.name: Redis
redis.about: The open source, in-memory data store used by millions of developers as a database, cache, streaming engine, and message broker.

docker.name: Docker
docker.about: Containerization technology that enables the creation and use of Linux® containers.

git.name: Git
git.about: Git is a free and open source distributed version control system designed to handle everything from small to very large projects with speed and efficiency.

jest.name: Jest
jest.about: Jest is a delightful JavaScript Testing Framework with a focus on simplicity.

cypress.name: Cypress
cypress.about: Cypress is a purely JavaScript-based front-end testing tool built for the modern web.

cucumber.name: Cucumber
cucumber.about: Cucumber is a software tool that supports behavior-driven development.

numpy.name: NumPy
numpy.about: NumPy offers comprehensive mathematical functions, random number generators, linear algebra routines, Fourier transforms, and more.

pandas.name: Pandas
pandas.about: pandas is a fast, powerful, flexible and easy to use open source data analysis and manipulation tool, built on top of the Python programming language.

sklearn.name: Scikit-Learn
sklearn.about: Scikit-learn (Sklearn) is the most useful and robust library for machine learning in Python.

tensorflow.name: Tensorflow
tensorflow.about: TensorFlow is an open-source library developed by Google primarily for deep learning applications.

opencv.name: OpenCV
opencv.about: OpenCV provides a real-time optimized Computer Vision library, tools, and hardware. It also supports model execution for Machine Learning (ML)

wasm.name: Webassembly
wasm.about: WebAssembly (abbreviated Wasm) is a binary instruction format for a stack-based virtual machine. Wasm is designed as a portable compilation target for programming languages, enabling deployment on the web for client and server applications.

bash.name: BASH
bash.about: Bash is the shell, or command language interpreter, for the GNU operating system.

vim.name: VIM
vim.about: Vim is a highly configurable text editor built to make creating and changing any kind of text very efficient.

apollo.name: Apollo
apollo.about: Apollo Client is a comprehensive state management library for JavaScript that enables you to manage both local and remote data with GraphQL.

socketio.name: Socket.io
socketio.about: Bidirectional and low-latency communication for every platform

electron.name: Electron
electron.about: Build cross-platform desktop apps with JavaScript, HTML, and CSS

tauri.name: Tauri
tauri.about: Build an optimized, secure, and frontend-independent application for multi-platform deployment.
